channel.title: Abouts on Yijun's homepage
channel.description: Recent content in Abouts on Yijun's homepage

item.title: About
item.description:
I am a second year Master’s student in Center for Data Science at New York University. My interests broadly lie in machine learning/deep learning, mostly their applications to natural language processing. I am also interested in reinforcement learning and wish to learn more about it.

Previously, I received my B.E. and M.S. in Civil Engineering from Tsinghua University and UC Davis respectively.

Papers

  • Yijun Xiao and Kyunghyun Cho. Efficient Character-level Document Classification by Combining Convolution and Recurrent Layers. arXiv:1602.00367.

    Projects

  • Beer Recommendation. [Demo]

    Using rating and text review data from BeerAdvocate, built a recommender system for the users. Keywords: collaborative filtering, matrix factorization, TFIDF, GraphLab, Flask.

  • NYC Taxi Tipping Behavior Analysis. [Presentation]

    Analysis of relationships between tip percentage and payment type, location, time, weather condition, etc. Keywords: AWS, MapReduce, d3.js.

  • Predicting MLB Pitcher-batter Matchup Hit Rate.

    Built a latent factor model inspired by matrix factorization methods to predict hit rates of batter-pitcher matchups. Keywords: matrix factorization, TensorFlow.
